sections.name: General
sections.description: These are general configuration options that quantum uses for basic operation. These should be normally be set on a per server basis however some of these are capabale of fully automatic configuration.

options.name: Configuration File
options.description: The configuration file for quantum to use to pull user supplied configuration options from. Can be in either ``json`` or ``yaml`` syntax.

sections.name: Plugins
sections.description: These configuration options apply to the various plugins.

options.name: Plugins
options.description: The list of plugins to enable within `quantum`.

sections.name: Datastore
sections.description: These are datastore specific configuration options, and specifically apply to how ``quantum`` interacts with the backend datastore.

options.name: Prefix
options.description: The prefix to use in the backend datastore to store ``quantum`` data under.

sections.name: DTLS
sections.description: These configuration options apply only when using the ``DTLS`` networking backend that ``quantum`` provides. They control how the network is interacted with.

options.name: Skip Certificate Verification
options.description:
Whether or not ``quantum`` should skip certificate verification. 
  WARNING: setting this to ``true`` is a security risk.

sections.name: Stats
sections.description: This set of configuration options apply to the rest api that ``quantum`` exposes for easy access to the internal metrics it collects.

options.name: Route
options.description: The URI route that the internal rest api listens on for handling metric requests.

sections.name: Network
sections.description: These configuration options define the ``quantum`` network that the instance will participate in. NOTE: Once these settings are persisted into the backend datastore these settings are completely ignored.

options.name: Network Subnet
options.description: The overarching subnet that will constitute the ``quantum`` network.
